Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Class Virtuoso

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.Virtuoso
  • public class Virtuoso
extends Object
    The main class for interacting with Virtuoso
    Use this class to:
    • Create concrete implementations of Virtuoso asset interfaces
    • Enqueue Assets for download
    • Register observers for notification of Virtuoso events
    CategoryTitle:
    001_startup Starting Up, 002_assetCreation Creating Assets, 003_queue Interacting with Download Queue, 004_engineInteract Interacting with Download Engine, 005_backplane Interacting with Backplane, 006_config Configuring Virtuoso, 007_observer Handling Observers, 008_assetManipulation Retrieving and Manipulating Assets, 009_throughput Measuring Throughput, 010_storage Detecting Available Storage, 011_subscriptions Configuring Subscriptions and Feeds

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates a new Virtuoso instance, but without registering an observer for notification when the background service is connected.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Virtuoso

        public Virtuoso​(Context c)
        Creates a new Virtuoso instance, but without registering an observer for notification when the background service is connected. Uses default Virtuoso settings.
        Parameters:
        c - Context to use for registering observers.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if it was not possible to ascertain the authority of the client's content provider
        IllegalArgumentException - if context is null.

    • Method Detail

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Unregister any observers and unbind from the background service. Must be called in onPause of an activity.

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Bind to the background service. Must be called in onResume of an activity.

      • startup

        public void startup​(URL aBackplaneUrl,
                    String aUser,
                    String aExternalDeviceID,
                    String aPublicKey,
                    String aPrivateKey,
                    IPushRegistrationObserver aPushRegistrationObserver)
        You must call this method so that Virtuoso can register itself with the Backplane. Once this method is successful, you need never call this method again unless updating keys or switching users.

        You'll need to call this if AuthenticationStatus==AuthenticationStatus.NOT_AUTHENTICATED.

        Registering with the Backplane allows the device to fetch global configuration values for download behavior and windowing rules. It allows Virtuoso to post events to the Backplane and receive push notifications from the Backplane. It allows the Backplane to police the number of allowable download-enabled devices per user.

        Successful registration or failures are reported through the requestComplete callback in IBackplaneObserver with a callback type of BackplaneCallbackType.REGISTER.
        Retrieve the current authentication status by calling authenticationStatus.

        When calling this method the following holds true:
        1) If between calls the User Id changes then the SDK will reset. It will delete all existing files and reset the user data before attempting to register the new user with the Backplane.
        2) If between calls ONLY the keys are changed then the SDK will store the new values and attempt to sync in order to get a new license.
        3) If between calls the keys and User Id change then the SDK will perform all actions from condition (1) and will also delete any outstanding events that need to be reported to the Backplane.
        4) If AuthenticationStatus==AuthenticationStatus.AUTHENTICATED and there are no changes to the keys or User id then this is a NOOP and no callbacks will be performed.

        Parameters:
        aBackplaneUrl - Backplane URL
        aUser - User ID to associate with this Device on the Backplane. The user ID can be a maximum of 512 characters. Backplane registration will fail if it is larger.
        aExternalDeviceID - (Optional; can be null) Externally defined device ID. Virtuoso will maintain this so you can refer to this device with this handle.
        aPublicKey - Public key used to encrypt HTTP requests made to the Backplane. Get this from Penthera.
        aPrivateKey - Private key used to encrypt requests made to the Backplane. Get this from Penthera.
        aPushRegistrationObserver - Observer for monitoring whether the push registration is successful
        See Also:
        Observers.IBackplaneObserver
        Category:
        001_startup

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        You can call this method to stop the Virtuoso engine from performing any further actions, but without unregistering from the Backplane or removing any content which has already been downloaded.
        You will need to call startup again to restart Virtuoso if shutdown has been called previously. If startup is called with the same registration details as previously then the system will resume from the previous state. If registration details differ then the state will be reset.

      • getService

        public IService getService()
        Handle for binding to the background service and making direct calls.

        Some calls within Virtuoso require direct communication with the background download service. These calls consist of pausing / resuming downloads, ascertaining current status of the service and retrieving network throughput data. This interface provides the means for clients to create a persistent connection only when they need it.

        Returns:
        Interface for binding and making direct calls to the service
        See Also:
        IService

      • getAssetManager

        public IAssetManager getAssetManager()
        Retrieve a handle on the Asset Manager.
        The Asset Manager provides access to the listing of Assets and to Cursors of Assets in common states.
        Returns:
        The Asset Manager
        Category:
        008_assetManipulation

      • getStorageUsed

        public long getStorageUsed()
        Amount of disk space that Virtuoso is currently using to store ALL downloaded assets
        Returns:
        Storage used, in MB
        Category:
        010_storage

      • getAllowableStorageRemaining

        public long getAllowableStorageRemaining()
        Total amount of storage available to Virtuoso for downloaded assets
        This value is not the total space on disk. It is the value of storage permitted after the headroom and max storage settings have been applied.
        Returns:
        Total amount of storage available, in MB
        Category:
        010_storage

      • isPowerStatusOK

        public boolean isPowerStatusOK()
        Check that there is sufficient charge for Virtuoso to download.
        Returns:
        True if Virtuoso is not currently blocked on a setting related to battery charge
        Category:
        006_config

      • getBlockedReasonFlags

        public int getBlockedReasonFlags()
        Check for reasons that the download is currently reporting as blocked. Flags will contain enumerated values from Common.EngineBlockedReason indicating the primary reasons for being blocked.
        Returns:
        An integer containing flags for each of the states currently causing the engine to be blocked
        Category:
        006_config

      • getUtilizedCellularDataQuota

        public long getUtilizedCellularDataQuota()
        Amount of cell quota that has been used in this cycle
        Returns:
        The amount of cell quota used in this cycle, in MB
        Category:
        006_config

        public IBackplane getBackplane()

        Returns:
        The Backplane
        Category:
        005_backplane

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver​(Observers.IObserver obs)
        Add an Observer. If the passed-in observer implements more than one of the Virtuoso Observer interfaces, then each interface will be registered with Virtuoso.

        Refer to the documentation on SDK Observers to see what types of observers are available.
        Parameters:
        obs - The observer
        See Also:
        Observers.IQueueObserver, Observers.IEngineObserver, Observers.IBackplaneObserver, Observers.IConnectivityObserver
        Category:
        007_observer

      • removeObserver

        public void removeObserver​(Observers.IObserver obs)
        Remove an Observer. If the passed-in observer implements more than one of the Virtuoso Observer interfaces, all of those interfaces will be removed.
        Parameters:
        obs - The observer to remove
        See Also:
        Observers.IQueueObserver, Observers.IEngineObserver, Observers.IBackplaneObserver, Observers.IConnectivityObserver
        Category:
        007_observer

      • getKeyStore

        public IKeyStore getKeyStore()
                      throws KeyStoreException
        Virtuoso key store
        Allows caller to add client certificates for mutual SSL authentication
        Returns:
        Key store
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - If a problem occurred during key store retrieval
        See Also:
        IKeyStore

      • getCurrentVirtuosoTime

        public Date getCurrentVirtuosoTime()
        get current secure virtuoso clock time
        Returns the current secure virtuoso clock time used for asset expiration calculations or null if the secure clock does not have a trusted value
        Returns:
        Date object containing the current secure clock time or null

      • getCurrentTime

        public Date getCurrentTime()
        get current secure virtuoso clock time or system time if secure clock is not trusted
        Returns the current secure virtuoso clock time used for asset expiration calculations or the current system time if the secure clock does not have a trusted value
        Returns:
        Date object containing the current secure clock time or current system time

      • getHTTPProxyBaseUri

        public String getHTTPProxyBaseUri()
        Get the base URI for the HTTP proxy when it is available. When the proxy is not yet initialised this can return a null response. In this case try again after a delay. The service must be running for the player to use it.
        To ensure the service is running, be sure to include the service and metadata declarations in the Android Manifest: 
         
 <meta-data android:name="com.penthera.virtuososdk.clienthttpservice.enabled" android:value="true" />

 <service android:name="com.penthera.virtuososdk.service.VirtuosoClientHTTPService"
            android:label="VirtuosoClientHTTPService"
            android:exported="false"
            android:process=":vservice" >
    <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="virtuoso.intent.action.START_VIRTUOSO_CLIENT_HTTP_SERVICE" />
    </intent-filter>
 </service>
        Returns:
        HTTP Proxy base URI, consisting of scheme and authority.
